channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: China AI Rally Laggard Baidu Faces Low Bar for Earnings Boost
item.description: The current earnings season has largely been a letdown for China’s big tech stocks, lowering the hurdle for Baidu Inc. to impress investors seeking a fresh angle on the artificial intelligence theme.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: Nvidia CEO Urges US to Lower Barriers to $50 Billion China Arena
item.description: Nvidia Corp. chief Jensen Huang called on the US to ease restrictions on the export of AI technology to China, or risk losing out on billions of dollars in revenue to up-and-coming rivals such as Huawei Technologies Co.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lanhee Lee, Vlad Savov

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: Inside the First Stargate AI Data Center
item.description: OpenAI, Oracle and SoftBank hope that the site in Texas is the first of many across the US.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary, Brody Ford, Emily Chang

media:content.media:description: The future home of the first Stargate site in Abilene, Texas.

item.title: China Threatens Enforcers of US’s Huawei Curbs With Legal Action
item.description: China said it could take legal action against anyone enforcing US restrictions on using Huawei Technologies Co.’s AI chips, escalating a dispute that’s upset a tentative truce on tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Colum Murphy

media:content.media:description: (Photo by Joan Cros/NurPhoto via Getty Images) Photographer: NurPhoto/NurPhoto

item.title: ‘Fortnite’ Returns to Apple App Store After Four-Year Battle
item.description: Epic Games Inc.’s hit game Fortnite has returned to Apple Inc.’s App Store in the US after more than four years, following a fierce legal battle between the two companies.
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio, Mark Gurman

item.title: AI PCs Still Year or Two From Fulfilling Promise, Asus CEO Says
item.description: The new crop of artificial intelligence-powered PCs will take until 2026 or later to drive the market forward, according to Asustek Computer Inc. co-Chief Executive Officer Samson Hu.
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Droulers, Vlad Savov

item.title: Kalshi Pulls Announcement of xAI Tie-Up Hours After Touting Deal
item.description: Kalshi Inc. withdrew announcements about a collaboration with Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence firm xAI just hours after a top executive at the prediction markets firm touted the deal.
item.dc:creator: Paige Smith

media:content.media:description: The Kalshi logo arranged on a smartphone in New York, US, on Monday, Feb. 10, 2025. The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is asking Crypto.com and Kalshi Inc. to explain how their recently launched Super Bowl event contracts comply with derivatives regulations. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Wolfspeed Put Options Surge Before Report on Bankruptcy Plans
item.description: Traders ramped up bearish bets Tuesday on Wolfspeed Inc., before the Wall Street Journal reported after regular market hours that the ailing chip component maker is preparing to file for bankruptcy protection within weeks.
item.dc:creator: David Marino, Bernard Goyder

media:content.media:description: The Wolfspeed, Inc. logo on a smartphone screen in Reno, United States, on January 3, 2025.

item.title: Match Group Acquires ‘Her’ Dating App for Queer Women
item.description: Match Group has added ‘Her,’ a dating app for queer women, to its portfolio, Match Chief Executive Officer Spencer Rascoff said in a post on Linkedin.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: A progress pride flag during the Drag March LA protest in West Hollywood, California, US, on Sunday, April 9, 2023. The Los Angeles LGBT Center hosted the protest on Easter Sunday in response to the increasing number of anti-LGBTQ+ bills being introduced or passed in the United States. Photographer: Eric Thayer/Bloomberg

item.title: Bloomberg Retracts Story on Kalshi After Firm Rescinds Statement
item.description: Bloomberg retracted a story published earlier Tuesday saying that Kalshi would partner with artificial-intelligence firm xAI after Kalshi rescinded its statement announcing the product integration deal. The company said details of the release, which stated that the effort would provide users with tailored information, had not been mutually confirmed between the two firms.
item.dc:creator: Michael J Moore

item.title: Thames Tops List of Firms Facing Criminal Probes Over Pollution
item.description: Thames Water tops a list of water companies under criminal investigation for pollution by the UK government, a move that could complicate efforts to turn around the beleaguered British utility.
item.dc:creator: Priscila Azevedo Rocha

media:content.media:description: A Thames Water Ltd. van at a works location in London, UK, on Thursday, March 7, 2024. Thames Water is waiting for a verdict on whether it broke regulations by paying millions of pounds to investors last year.

item.title: What Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’ Can Learn From Israeli Air Defenses
item.description: An exclusive look at what Israel’s upgraded air defense system can (and can’t) do holds lessons for the US as it pushes for a missile shield.
item.dc:creator: Marissa Newman

media:content.media:description: The Iron Dome missile defense system intercepts rockets fired from Gaza, in Netivot, Israel, in October 2023.

item.title: WhatsApp Had No Plans to Vie With Facebook, Co-Founder Says
item.description: WhatsApp co-founder Brian Acton said that his messaging company had no plans to build social networking features to compete with Facebook before he sold the company to Mark Zuckerberg, a claim that bolsters Meta’s defense as it faces federal antitrust allegations.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner, Sabrina Willmer

media:content.media:description: The Facebook Inc. WhatsApp logo on a smartphone arranged in the Brooklyn Borough of New York, U.S., on Tuesday, Oct. 5, 2021. Signal and Telegram, two private messenger apps, saw downloads and user sign-ups soar during the extended downtime of Facebook Inc.’s network of apps and services.

item.title: Dell Tech World, Musk Commits to Staying at Tesla | Bloomberg Technology
item.description: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow, live from Dell Technologies World, discusses developments in AI infrastructure. Plus, Elon Musk says he is committed to running Tesla for the next five years. And Cohere CEO Aidan Gomez says the competitor to OpenAI has doubled its revenue since the start of the year. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Take-Two Dips as Video-Game Maker Preps $1 Billion Stock Sale
item.description: Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. shares fell as much as 5% in extended trading after the company announced plans to sell $1 billion of new stock to investors.
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: Grand Theft Auto VI is now slated to release in May 2026

item.title: Amazon Gives Refunds for Years-Old Returns
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. customers are suddenly getting refunds for products they purchased and returned as far back as 2018, along with apologies from the online retailer after it discovered “unresolved” issues.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Soper

media:content.media:description: Amazon packages in a UPS truck in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, April 29, 2025. Amazon.com Inc. is expected to release earnings figures on May 1.

item.title: Uber Squeezes More From Aurora Stake With $1.2 Billion Bond Sale
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc.’s $1.2 billion exchangeable bond deal, linked to its shares in a self-driving truck firm, shows why the unusual financial maneuver can be more attractive than a typical stake sale, according to observers.
item.dc:creator: Yiqin Shen, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: An Aurora Innovation Inc. driverless truck at the company's terminal in Palmer, Texas, US, on Wednesday, Dec. 28, 2023. Driverless trucks with no humans on board will soon cruise Texas, highways if three startup firms have their way, despite objections from critics who say financial pressures, not safety, is behind the timetable.

item.title: Xreal and Google Debut Aura AR Glasses to Rival Meta’s Orion Plan
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google has entered the glasses race by partnering with Xreal Inc. on the first spectacles to run an augmented-reality version of its operating system.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Project Aura glasses.

item.title: Jimmy Fallon Offered $1 Million Air-Taxi Bet by Short Seller
item.description: Air taxi company Archer Aviation Inc. has been targeted by short sellers before, but the latest attack has an unusual twist: A proposed $1 million “friendly wager” with the TV show host Jimmy Fallon.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke, Sam Potter

media:content.media:description: Adam Goldstein during an interview with host Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show in New York on May 15.

item.title: Alphabet’s Google Bringing AI Mode to Search for US
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google will offer “AI mode” in search to all US users, part of an effort to bring products to market faster and keep pace with new rivals in the artificial intelligence age.
item.dc:creator: Julia Love, Davey Alba

media:content.media:description: Sundar Pichai, chief executive officer of Alphabet Inc., during an interview for an episode of "The David Rubenstein Show: Peer-to-Peer Conversations" in New York, US, on Friday, Sept. 20, 2024. Pichai said it will take many years to resolve Google's antitrust battles, downplaying the idea that they pose an immediate threat to the company's business.

item.title: Microsoft-Backed Builder.ai Set for Bankruptcy After Cash Seized
item.description: Builder.ai, the British artificial intelligence startup backed by Microsoft Corp. and the Qatar Investment Authority, is filing for bankruptcy after the chief executive officer said a major creditor had seized most of its cash.
item.dc:creator: Yazhou Sun

media:content.media:description: The Builder.ai logo.

item.title: Google Bringing Products to Market Faster: Alphabet CEO
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said Google will bring products to market faster to keep pace with new rivals in the artificial intelligence age. “We want to get our best models into your hands,” Pichai said Tuesday at the company’s developer conference in Mountain View, California, “so we are shipping faster than ever.”

item.title: Musk Commits to Tesla CEO Role and Plans Political Pullback
item.description: Elon Musk said he’s committed to still leading Tesla Inc. five years from now and expects to pare back his political spending, assuaging some investors’ concerns about the future of his most valuable company.
item.dc:creator: Dana Hull, Mishal Husain

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk speaks via video link at the Qatar Economic Forum on May 20. Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

item.title: DoorDash Ends AI Voice-Ordering Product for Restaurants
item.description: DoorDash Inc. ended a pilot of its voice-ordering product for restaurant clients, a year after it poached talent from an artificial intelligence startup to bolster the product.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: A DoorDash sign outside a restaurant in New York, US, on Tuesday, May 6, 2025. In a matter of five hours, the US delivery firm DoorDash Inc. announced two multibillion-dollar acquisitions that stand to turn what is already the largest food-delivery service in the US into a formidable global player. Photographer: Yuki Iwamura/Bloomberg

item.title: AI Startup Cohere Has Doubled Sales So Far This Year, CEO Says
item.description: Cohere Inc. Chief Executive Officer Aidan Gomez said the artificial intelligence startup has “more than doubled” its revenue since the start of this year and is approaching profitability, even as it faces heightened competition for business customers from OpenAI and Anthropic.
item.dc:creator: Seth Fiegerman, Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Aidan Gomez, chief executive officer of Cohere Inc., following a Bloomberg Television interview in London, UK, on Tuesday, Oct. 31, 2023. UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was hoping his AI summit would bring heads of the most powerful nations face-to-face with executives to guard against the technology's “catastrophic” potential.

item.title: Apple to Open AI Models to Developers, Betting That It Will Spur New Apps
item.description: Apple Inc. is preparing to allow third-party developers to write software using its artificial intelligence models, aiming to spur the creation of new applications and make its devices more enticing.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Apple Intelligence signage outside the company's Fifth Avenue store in New York, US, on Monday, Feb. 24, 2025. Apple Inc., as it seeks relief from US President Donald Trump's tariffs on goods imported from China, said that it will hire 20,000 new workers and produce AI servers in the US.

item.title: Why Are Deepfakes Everywhere? Can They Be Stopped?
item.description: The internet is awash in deepfakes — audio, pictures or video made using artificial intelligence tools in which people appear to do or say things they didn’t, be somewhere they weren’t, or that change their appearance. Some involve nudification, where photos are altered to depict someone unclothed. Other deepfakes are deployed to scam consumers, or to damage the reputations of politicians and other people in the public eye.
item.dc:creator: Nate Lanxon, Omar El Chmouri

media:content.media:description: The news conference to unveil the Take It Down Act, in Washington, DC, in June 2024. Photographer: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images

item.title: Amazon’s Zoox Expands Robotaxi Trials to Rival Turf in Atlanta
item.description: Amazon.com Inc.’s Zoox is expanding testing of its autonomous driving technology to Atlanta, moving in on a market where Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo is expanding with Uber Technologies Inc.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: A Zoox autonomous robotaxi in San Francisco, California. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Pony AI Robotaxi Revenue Triples Ahead of Commercialization
item.description: Pony AI Inc.’s first-quarter robotaxi revenue tripled with the Chinese autonomous vehicle firm setting its sights on large-scale commercialization of services later this year.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo

media:content.media:description: Pony AI Robotaxis.

item.title: Alphabet Traders Look to Developer Event to Shift AI Narrative
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s investors are looking to this week’s developer conference to see if the company can reset the narrative amid fears that its long-standing market dominance is on shaky ground.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: The Google Cloud Next "25: AI Exclusive at the Sphere" event in April.
